strategy: Implement a Random Forest Regressor with hyperparameter tuning using GridSearchCV or RandomizedSearchCV.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Handle NaN values
train_df.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)
test_df.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
train_df = pd.get_dummies(train_df)
test_df = pd.get_dummies(test_df)

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']

# Initialize RandomForestRegressor
rf_regressor = RandomForestRegressor()

# Define hyperparameters for GridSearchCV
param_grid = {
    'n_estimators': [100, 200, 300],
    'max_depth': [None, 10, 20, 30],
    'min_samples_split': [2, 5, 10]
}

# Perform grid search
grid_search = GridSearchCV(estimator=rf_regressor, param_grid=param_grid, cv=3, scoring='neg_mean_squared_error', n_jobs=-1)
grid_search.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Get best parameters and best estimator
best_params = grid_search.best_params_
best_rf_regressor = grid_search.best_estimator_

# Predict on test set
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])
predictions = best_rf_regressor.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_df['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})

# Save submission CSV
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Handle NaN values
train_df.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)
test_df.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)

# Combine train and test data for consistent encoding
combined_df = pd.concat([train_df, test_df], ignore_index=True)

# Encode categorical variables
combined_df = pd.get_dummies(combined_df)

# Separate back into train and test sets
train_df_encoded = combined_df[:len(train_df)]
test_df_encoded = combined_df[len(train_df):]

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df_encoded.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_df_encoded['SalePrice']
X_test = test_df_encoded.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Initialize RandomForestRegressor
rf_regressor = RandomForestRegressor()

# Define hyperparameters for GridSearchCV
param_grid = {
    'n_estimators': [100, 200, 300],
    'max_depth': [None, 10, 20, 30],
    'min_samples_split': [2, 5, 10]
}

# Perform grid search
grid_search = GridSearchCV(estimator=rf_regressor, param_grid=param_grid, cv=3, scoring='neg_mean_squared_error', n_jobs=-1)
grid_search.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Get best parameters and best estimator
best_params = grid_search.best_params_
best_rf_regressor = grid_search.best_estimator_

# Predict on test set
predictions = best_rf_regressor.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_df['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})

# Save submission CSV
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Handle NaN values
train_df.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)
test_df.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)

# Combine train and test data for consistent encoding
combined_df = pd.concat([train_df, test_df], ignore_index=True)

# Remove 'SalePrice' from the combined dataset to avoid leakage
if 'SalePrice' in combined_df.columns:
    combined_df.drop(columns=['SalePrice'], inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
combined_df = pd.get_dummies(combined_df)

# Separate back into train and test sets
train_df_encoded = combined_df[:len(train_df)]
test_df_encoded = combined_df[len(train_df):]

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df_encoded.drop(columns=['Id'])
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_test = test_df_encoded.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Initialize RandomForestRegressor
rf_regressor = RandomForestRegressor()

# Define hyperparameters for GridSearchCV
param_grid = {
    'n_estimators': [100, 200, 300],
    'max_depth': [None, 10, 20, 30],
    'min_samples_split': [2, 5, 10]
}

# Perform grid search
grid_search = GridSearchCV(estimator=rf_regressor, param_grid=param_grid, cv=3, scoring='neg_mean_squared_error', n_jobs=-1)
grid_search.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Get best parameters and best estimator
best_params = grid_search.best_params_
best_rf_regressor = grid_search.best_estimator_

# Predict on test set
predictions = best_rf_regressor.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_df['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})

# Save submission CSV
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE
